intro: Maharanga dumetorum, commonly known as the New Zealand rock parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in New Zealand.
